welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content:
# Commando
[![Discord](https://discordapp.com/api/guilds/222078108977594368/embed.png)](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9)
[![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/discord.js-commando.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js-commando)
[![Version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/discord.js-commando.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js-commando)
[![Dependency status](https://david-dm.org/discordjs/Commando.svg)](https://david-dm.org/discordjs/Commando)
[![Build status](https://travis-ci.org/discordjs/Commando.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/discordjs/Commando)

## About
Commando is the official command framework for [discord.js](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js).
It is flexible, fully object-oriented, easy to use, and makes it trivial to create your own powerful commands.
Additionally, it makes full use of ES2017's `async`/`await` functionality for clear, concise code that is simple to write and easy to comprehend.

## Features
- Plain command names and aliases
- Regular expression triggers
- Robust parsing of arguments (with "quoted strings" support)
- Sophisticated argument system (optional)
	* Automatic prompting for arguments that aren't provided
	* Type system with rules, automatic validation, and parsing to usable values
		- Basic types (string, integer, float, boolean)
		- Discord objects (user, member, role, channel, message)
		- User-defined custom types
		- Union types
	* Automatic re-prompting of invalid arguments
	* Optional arguments with default values
	* Infinite arguments (arguments that accept as many values as provided)
- Multiple responses to commands
- Command editing (user edits their message that triggered the command, and the bot's response updates with it)
- Command reloading, as well as loading/unloading
- Command throttling/cooldowns

## Installation
**Node 8.6.0 or newer is required.**  
`npm install discord.js-commando`

first-steps.name: First steps

builtins.name: Built-in commands
builtins.content:
# Built-in commands
Commando has built-in commands that should be useful for just about any bot.

## Utility (util)
### help (util:help)
If no arguments are specified, the command displays a list of all commands available in the current context.
In order for a command to be displayed, it must be enabled in the guild (or global), and the user must have permission to use it.
Passing the `all` argument will list all commands, regardless of context.
Passing anything else will search for any commands that match, and display detailed information if only one is found.

### ping (util:ping)
The ping command will send a message, then edit it to contain the amount of time it took.
It also displays the client's heartbeat ping.

### prefix (util:prefix)
This command, if not provided with any arguments, will display the current command prefix, and how to use commands.
If the command is used in a guild channel and an argument is specified, it will set the command prefix for the guild if the user is a guild admin, or the bot owner,
If the command is used in a DM and an argument is specified, it will set the global default command prefix if the user is the bot owner.

### eval (util:eval)
The eval command will allow the bot owner to evaluate any JavaScript code, and display its result.
It will automatically hide the bot's token/email/password in the output.
Caution should still be taken, however, as you could potentially break your running bot with it.

In the script, `this` will refer to the Command instance.
There are several shortcut variables and helpers that are also available:

| Name             | Type     | Description                                                                        |
|------------------|----------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `message`, `msg` | Variable | The message that triggered the command                                             |
| `client`         | Variable | Shortcut to `this.client`                                                          |
| `objects`        | Variable | Shortcut to `this.client.registry.evalObjects`                                     |
| `lastResult`     | Variable | Shortcut to `this.lastResult` (the previous `eval` result value)                   |
| `doReply(val)`   | Function | Sends another detailed message with any value to display. Useful for callbacks.    |

## Command state (commands)
### enable (commands:enable)
Enables a command/group in the current guild if the user is an admin or the bot owner.
If used in a DM, enables the command/group globally by default if the user is the bot owner.

### disable (commands:disable)
Disables a command/group in the current guild if the user is an admin or the bot owner.
If used in a DM, disables the command/group globally by default if the user is the bot owner.

### reload (commands:reload)
Reloads a command, or all commands in a group, if the user is the bot owner.

### load (commands:load)
Loads a command if the user is the bot owner. The command must be specified as the full name (`group:memberName`).
Built-in commands cannot be loaded.

### unload (commands:unload)
Unloads a command if the user is the bot owner.
Built-in commands cannot be unloaded.

### groups (commands:groups)
Lists all command groups if the user is an admin of the current guild, or the bot owner.

classes.name: CommandoClient
classes.description: Discord.js Client with a command framework

props.name: registry
props.description: The client's command registry

props.name: dispatcher
props.description: The client's command dispatcher

props.name: provider
props.description: The client's setting provider

props.name: settings
props.description: Shortcut to use setting provider methods for the global settings

props.name: _commandPrefix
props.description: Internal global command prefix, controlled by the {@link CommandoClient#commandPrefix} getter/setter

props.name: commandPrefix
props.description:
Global command prefix. An empty string indicates that there is no default prefix, and only mentions will be used.
Setting to `null` means that the default prefix from {@link CommandoClient#options} will be used instead.

props.name: owners
props.description:
Owners of the bot, set by the {@link CommandoClientOptions#owner} option
<info>If you simply need to check if a user is an owner of the bot, please instead use
{@link CommandoClient#isOwner}.</info>

methods.name: isOwner
methods.description: Checks whether a user is an owner of the bot (in {@link CommandoClientOptions#owner})

methods.name: setProvider
methods.description: Sets the setting provider to use, and initialises it once the client is ready

events.name: providerReady
events.description: Emitted upon the client's provider finishing initialisation

events.name: unknownCommand
events.description: Emitted when an unknown command is triggered

params.name: message
params.description: Command message that triggered the command

events.name: groupRegister
events.description: Emitted when a group is registered

params.name: registry
params.description: Registry that the group was registered to

events.name: commandRegister
events.description: Emitted when a command is registered

params.name: registry
params.description: Registry that the command was registered to

events.name: typeRegister
events.description: Emitted when an argument type is registered

params.name: registry
params.description: Registry that the type was registered to

events.name: commandReregister
events.description: Emitted when a command is reregistered

events.name: commandUnregister
events.description: Emitted when a command is unregistered

events.name: commandPrefixChange
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild's command prefix is changed

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild that the prefix was changed in (null for global)

events.name: commandStatusChange
events.description: Emitted whenever a command is enabled/disabled in a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild that the command was enabled/disabled in (null for global)

events.name: groupStatusChange
events.description: Emitted whenever a command group is enabled/disabled in a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild that the group was enabled/disabled in (null for global)

events.name: commandBlock
events.description: Emitted when a command is prevented from running

params.name: message
params.description: Command message that the command is running from

params.name: reason
params.description:
Reason that the command was blocked
(built-in reasons are `guildOnly`, `nsfw`, `permission`, `throttling`, and `clientPermissions`)

params.name: data
params.description:
Additional data associated with the block. Built-in reason data properties:
- guildOnly: none
- nsfw: none
- permission: `response` ({@link string}) to send
- throttling: `throttle` ({@link Object}), `remaining` ({@link number}) time in seconds
- clientPermissions: `missing` ({@link Array}<{@link string}>) permission names

events.name: commandCancel
events.description: Emitted when a command is cancelled (either by typing 'cancel' or not responding in time)

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason for the command being cancelled

params.name: message
params.description: Command message that the command ran from (see {@link Command#run})

params.name: result
params.description:
Result from obtaining the arguments from the collector
(if applicable - see {@link Command#run})

params.name: message
params.description: Command message that the command is running from (see {@link Command#run})

params.name: fromPattern
params.description: Whether the args are pattern matches (see {@link Command#run})

params.name: result
params.description:
Result from obtaining the arguments from the collector
(if applicable - see {@link Command#run})

events.name: commandError
events.description: Emitted when a command produces an error while running

params.name: message
params.description: Command message that the command is running from (see {@link Command#run})

params.name: fromPattern
params.description: Whether the args are pattern matches (see {@link Command#run})

params.name: result
params.description:
Result from obtaining the arguments from the collector
(if applicable - see {@link Command#run})

classes.name: CommandDispatcher
classes.description: Handles parsing messages and running commands from them

props.name: client
props.description: Client this dispatcher handles messages for

props.name: registry
props.description: Registry this dispatcher uses

props.name: inhibitors
props.description: Functions that can block commands from running

props.name: _commandPatterns
props.description: Map object of {@link RegExp}s that match command messages, mapped by string prefix

props.name: _results
props.description: Old command message results, mapped by original message ID

props.name: _awaiting
props.description: Tuples in string form of user ID and channel ID that are currently awaiting messages from a user in a channel

methods.name: addInhibitor
methods.description: Adds an inhibitor

methods.name: removeInhibitor
methods.description: Removes an inhibitor

methods.name: handleMessage
methods.description: Handle a new message or a message update

params.name: oldMessage
params.description: The old message before the update

methods.name: shouldHandleMessage
methods.description: Check whether a message should be handled

params.name: oldMessage
params.description: The old message before the update

methods.name: inhibit
methods.description: Inhibits a command message

methods.name: cacheCommandoMessage
methods.description: Caches a command message to be editable

methods.name: parseMessage
methods.description: Parses a message to find details about command usage in it

methods.name: matchDefault
methods.description: Matches a message against a guild command pattern

params.name: commandNameIndex
params.description: The index of the command name in the pattern matches

params.name: prefixless
params.description: Whether the match is happening for a prefixless usage

methods.name: buildCommandPattern
methods.description: Creates a regular expression to match the command prefix and name in a message

params.name: prefix
params.description: Prefix to build the pattern for

classes.name: CommandoRegistry
classes.description: Handles registration and searching of commands and groups

props.name: client
props.description: The client this registry is for

props.name: commands
props.description: Registered commands, mapped by their name

props.name: groups
props.description: Registered command groups, mapped by their ID

props.name: types
props.description: Registered argument types, mapped by their ID

props.name: commandsPath
props.description: Fully resolved path to the bot's commands directory

props.name: unknownCommand
props.description: Command to run when an unknown command is used

methods.name: registerGroup
methods.description: Registers a single group

params.name: group
params.description: A CommandGroup instance, a constructor, or the group ID

params.name: name
params.description: Name for the group (if the first argument is the group ID)

params.name: guarded
params.description: Whether the group should be guarded (if the first argument is the group ID)

methods.name: registerGroups
methods.description: Registers multiple groups

params.name: groups
params.description:
An array of CommandGroup instances,
constructors, plain objects (with ID, name, and guarded properties),
or arrays of {@link CommandoRegistry#registerGroup} parameters

methods.name: registerCommand
methods.description: Registers a single command

params.name: command
params.description: Either a Command instance, or a constructor for one

methods.name: registerCommands
methods.description: Registers multiple commands

params.name: commands
params.description: An array of Command instances or constructors

params.name: ignoreInvalid
params.description: Whether to skip over invalid objects without throwing an error

methods.name: registerCommandsIn
methods.description: Registers all commands in a directory. The files must export a Command class constructor or instance.

params.name: options
params.description: The path to the directory, or a require-all options object

methods.name: registerType
methods.description: Registers a single argument type

params.name: type
params.description: Either an ArgumentType instance, or a constructor for one

methods.name: registerTypes
methods.description: Registers multiple argument types

params.name: types
params.description: An array of ArgumentType instances or constructors

params.name: ignoreInvalid
params.description: Whether to skip over invalid objects without throwing an error

methods.name: registerTypesIn
methods.description: Registers all argument types in a directory. The files must export an ArgumentType class constructor or instance.

params.name: options
params.description: The path to the directory, or a require-all options object

methods.name: registerDefaults
methods.description:
Registers the default argument types, groups, and commands. This is equivalent to:
```js
registry.registerDefaultTypes()
	.registerDefaultGroups()
	.registerDefaultCommands();
```

methods.name: registerDefaultGroups
methods.description: Registers the default groups ("util" and "commands")

methods.name: registerDefaultCommands
methods.description: Registers the default commands to the registry

params.name: commands
params.description: Object specifying which commands to register

params.name: commands.help
params.description:
Whether to register the built-in help command
(requires "util" group and "string" type)

params.name: commands.prefix
params.description:
Whether to register the built-in prefix command
(requires "util" group and "string" type)

params.name: commands.eval
params.description:
Whether to register the built-in eval command
(requires "util" group and "string" type)

params.name: commands.ping
params.description: Whether to register the built-in ping command (requires "util" group)

params.name: commands.unknownCommand
params.description:
Whether to register the built-in unknown command
(requires "util" group)

params.name: commands.commandState
params.description:
Whether to register the built-in command state commands
(enable, disable, load, unload, reload, list groups - requires "commands" group, "command" type, and "group" type)

methods.name: registerDefaultTypes
methods.description: Registers the default argument types to the registry

params.name: types
params.description: Object specifying which types to register

params.name: types.string
params.description: Whether to register the built-in string type

params.name: types.integer
params.description: Whether to register the built-in integer type

params.name: types.float
params.description: Whether to register the built-in float type

params.name: types.boolean
params.description: Whether to register the built-in boolean type

params.name: types.user
params.description: Whether to register the built-in user type

params.name: types.member
params.description: Whether to register the built-in member type

params.name: types.role
params.description: Whether to register the built-in role type

params.name: types.channel
params.description: Whether to register the built-in channel type

params.name: types.textChannel
params.description: Whether to register the built-in text-channel type

params.name: types.voiceChannel
params.description: Whether to register the built-in voice-channel type

params.name: types.categoryChannel
params.description: Whether to register the built-in category-channel type

params.name: types.message
params.description: Whether to register the built-in message type

params.name: types.customEmoji
params.description: Whether to register the built-in custom-emoji type

params.name: types.defaultEmoji
params.description: Whether to register the built-in default-emoji type

params.name: types.command
params.description: Whether to register the built-in command type

params.name: types.group
params.description: Whether to register the built-in group type

methods.name: reregisterCommand
methods.description: Reregisters a command (does not support changing name, group, or memberName)

methods.name: unregisterCommand
methods.description: Unregisters a command

methods.name: findGroups
methods.description: Finds all groups that match the search string

params.name: exact
params.description: Whether the search should be exact

methods.name: resolveGroup
methods.description: Resolves a CommandGroupResolvable to a CommandGroup object

methods.name: findCommands
methods.description: Finds all commands that match the search string

params.name: exact
params.description: Whether the search should be exact

params.name: message
params.description: The message to check usability against

methods.name: resolveCommand
methods.description: Resolves a CommandResolvable to a Command object

methods.name: resolveCommandPath
methods.description: Resolves a command file path from a command's group ID and memberName

returns.description: Fully-resolved path to the corresponding command file

props.name: key
props.description: Key for the argument

props.name: label
props.description: Label for the argument

props.name: prompt
props.description: Question prompt for the argument

props.name: error
props.description: Error message for when a value is invalid

props.name: type
props.description: Type of the argument

props.name: max
props.description:
If type is `integer` or `float`, this is the maximum value of the number.
If type is `string`, this is the maximum length of the string.

props.name: min
props.description:
If type is `integer` or `float`, this is the minimum value of the number.
If type is `string`, this is the minimum length of the string.

props.name: default
props.description: The default value for the argument

props.name: oneOf
props.description:
Values the user can choose from
If type is `string`, this will be case-insensitive
If type is `channel`, `member`, `role`, or `user`, this will be the IDs.

props.name: infinite
props.description: Whether the argument accepts an infinite number of values

props.name: validator
props.description: Validator function for validating a value for the argument

props.name: parser
props.description: Parser function for parsing a value for the argument

props.name: emptyChecker
props.description: Function to check whether a raw value is considered empty

props.name: wait
props.description: How long to wait for input (in seconds)

methods.name: obtain
methods.description: Prompts the user and obtains the value for the argument

params.name: promptLimit
params.description: Maximum number of times to prompt for the argument

methods.name: obtainInfinite
methods.description: Prompts the user and obtains multiple values for the argument

params.name: promptLimit
params.description: Maximum number of times to prompt for the argument

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Checks if a value is valid for the argument

methods.name: parse
methods.description: Parses a value string into a proper value for the argument

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.description: Checks whether a value for the argument is considered to be empty

methods.name: validateInfo
methods.description: Validates the constructor parameters

methods.name: determineType
methods.description: Gets the argument type to use from an ID

params.name: client
params.description: Client to use the registry of

params.name: id
params.description: ID of the type to use

classes.name: Command
classes.description: A command that can be run in a client

params.name: client
params.description: The client the command is for

props.name: client
props.description: Client that this command is for

props.name: name
props.description: Name of this command

props.name: aliases
props.description: Aliases for this command

props.name: groupID
props.description: ID of the group the command belongs to

props.name: group
props.description: The group the command belongs to, assigned upon registration

props.name: memberName
props.description: Name of the command within the group

props.name: description
props.description: Short description of the command

props.name: format
props.description: Usage format string of the command

props.name: details
props.description: Long description of the command

props.name: examples
props.description: Example usage strings

props.name: guildOnly
props.description: Whether the command can only be run in a guild channel

props.name: ownerOnly
props.description: Whether the command can only be used by an owner

props.name: clientPermissions
props.description: Permissions required by the client to use the command.

props.name: userPermissions
props.description: Permissions required by the user to use the command.

props.name: nsfw
props.description: Whether the command can only be used in NSFW channels

props.name: defaultHandling
props.description: Whether the default command handling is enabled for the command

props.name: throttling
props.description: Options for throttling command usages

props.name: argsCollector
props.description: The argument collector for the command

props.name: argsType
props.description: How the arguments are split when passed to the command's run method

props.name: argsCount
props.description: Maximum number of arguments that will be split

props.name: argsSingleQuotes
props.description: Whether single quotes are allowed to encapsulate an argument

props.name: patterns
props.description: Regular expression triggers

props.name: guarded
props.description: Whether the command is protected from being disabled

props.name: hidden
props.description: Whether the command should be hidden from the help command

props.name: unknown
props.description: Whether the command will be run when an unknown command is used

props.name: _globalEnabled
props.description: Whether the command is enabled globally

props.name: _throttles
props.description: Current throttle objects for the command, mapped by user ID

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.description: Checks whether the user has permission to use the command

params.name: ownerOverride
params.description: Whether the bot owner(s) will always have permission

returns.description: Whether the user has permission, or an error message to respond with if they don't

methods.name: run
methods.description: Runs the command

params.name: message
params.description: The message the command is being run for

params.name: args
params.description:
The arguments for the command, or the matches from a pattern.
If args is specified on the command, thise will be the argument values object. If argsType is single, then only
one string will be passed. If multiple, an array of strings will be passed. When fromPattern is true, this is the
matches array from the pattern match
(see [RegExp#exec](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/RegExp/exec)).

params.name: fromPattern
params.description: Whether or not the command is being run from a pattern match

params.name: result
params.description: Result from obtaining the arguments from the collector (if applicable)

methods.name: onBlock
methods.description: Called when the command is prevented from running

params.name: message
params.description: Command message that the command is running from

params.name: reason
params.description:
Reason that the command was blocked
(built-in reasons are `guildOnly`, `nsfw`, `permission`, `throttling`, and `clientPermissions`)

params.name: data
params.description:
Additional data associated with the block. Built-in reason data properties:
- guildOnly: none
- nsfw: none
- permission: `response` ({@link string}) to send
- throttling: `throttle` ({@link Object}), `remaining` ({@link number}) time in seconds
- clientPermissions: `missing` ({@link Array}<{@link string}>) permission names

methods.name: onError
methods.description: Called when the command produces an error while running

params.name: message
params.description: Command message that the command is running from (see {@link Command#run})

params.name: fromPattern
params.description: Whether the args are pattern matches (see {@link Command#run})

params.name: result
params.description:
Result from obtaining the arguments from the collector
(if applicable - see {@link Command#run})

methods.name: throttle
methods.description: Creates/obtains the throttle object for a user, if necessary (owners are excluded)

params.name: userID
params.description: ID of the user to throttle for

methods.name: setEnabledIn
methods.description: Enables or disables the command in a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild to enable/disable the command in

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the command should be enabled or disabled

methods.name: isEnabledIn
methods.description: Checks if the command is enabled in a guild

params.name: bypassGroup
params.description: Whether to bypass checking the group's status

methods.name: isUsable
methods.description: Checks if the command is usable for a message

methods.name: usage
methods.description: Creates a usage string for the command

params.name: argString
params.description: A string of arguments for the command

params.name: prefix
params.description: Prefix to use for the prefixed command format

params.name: user
params.description: User to use for the mention command format

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Reloads the command

methods.name: unload
methods.description: Unloads the command

methods.name: usage
methods.description: Creates a usage string for a command

params.name: prefix
params.description: Prefix to use for the prefixed command format

params.name: user
params.description: User to use for the mention command format

methods.name: validateInfo
methods.description: Validates the constructor parameters

classes.name: ArgumentCollector
classes.description: Obtains, validates, and prompts for argument values

params.name: promptLimit
params.description: Maximum number of times to prompt for a single argument

props.name: client
props.description: Client this collector is for

props.name: args
props.description: Arguments the collector handles

props.name: promptLimit
props.description: Maximum number of times to prompt for a single argument

methods.name: obtain
methods.description: Obtains values for the arguments, prompting if necessary.

params.name: msg
params.description: Message that the collector is being triggered by

params.name: promptLimit
params.description: Maximum number of times to prompt for a single argument

params.name: client
params.description: The client the group is for

params.name: guarded
params.description: Whether the group should be protected from disabling

props.name: client
props.description: Client that this group is for

props.name: id
props.description: ID of this group

props.name: name
props.description: Name of this group

props.name: commands
props.description: The commands in this group (added upon their registration)

props.name: guarded
props.description: Whether or not this group is protected from being disabled

methods.name: setEnabledIn
methods.description: Enables or disables the group in a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild to enable/disable the group in

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the group should be enabled or disabled

methods.name: isEnabledIn
methods.description: Checks if the group is enabled in a guild

returns.description: Whether or not the group is enabled

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Reloads all of the group's commands

classes.name: CommandFormatError
classes.description: Has a descriptive message for a command not having proper format

params.name: msg
params.description: The command message the error is for

classes.name: FriendlyError
classes.description: Has a message that can be considered user-friendly

classes.name: CommandoGuild
classes.description: A fancier Guild for fancier people.

props.name: settings
props.description: Shortcut to use setting provider methods for this guild

props.name: _commandPrefix
props.description:
Internal command prefix for the guild, controlled by the {@link CommandoGuild#commandPrefix}
getter/setter

props.name: commandPrefix
props.description:
Command prefix in the guild. An empty string indicates that there is no prefix, and only mentions will be used.
Setting to `null` means that the prefix from {@link CommandoClient#commandPrefix} will be used instead.

props.name: _commandsEnabled
props.description: Map object of internal command statuses, mapped by command name

props.name: _groupsEnabled
props.description: Internal map object of group statuses, mapped by group ID

methods.name: setCommandEnabled
methods.description: Sets whether a command is enabled in the guild

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the command should be enabled

methods.name: isCommandEnabled
methods.description: Checks whether a command is enabled in the guild (does not take the command's group status into account)

methods.name: setGroupEnabled
methods.description: Sets whether a command group is enabled in the guild

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the group should be enabled

methods.name: isGroupEnabled
methods.description: Checks whether a command group is enabled in the guild

methods.name: commandUsage
methods.description: Creates a command usage string using the guild's prefix

params.name: user
params.description: User to use for the mention command format

classes.name: CommandoMessage
classes.description: An extension of the base Discord.js Message class to add command-related functionality.

props.name: isCommand
props.description: Whether the message contains a command (even an unknown one)

props.name: command
props.description: Command that the message triggers, if any

props.name: argString
props.description: Argument string for the command

props.name: patternMatches
props.description: Pattern matches (if from a pattern trigger)

props.name: responses
props.description: Response messages sent, mapped by channel ID (set by the dispatcher after running the command)

props.name: responsePositions
props.description: Index of the current response that will be edited, mapped by channel ID

methods.name: initCommand
methods.description: Initialises the message for a command

params.name: patternMatches
params.description: Command pattern matches (if from a pattern trigger)

methods.name: usage
methods.description: Creates a usage string for the message's command

params.name: argString
params.description: A string of arguments for the command

params.name: prefix
params.description:
Prefix to use for the
prefixed command format

params.name: user
params.description: User to use for the mention command format

methods.name: anyUsage
methods.description: Creates a usage string for any command

params.name: prefix
params.description:
Prefix to use for the
prefixed command format

params.name: user
params.description: User to use for the mention command format

methods.name: parseArgs
methods.description: Parses the argString into usable arguments, based on the argsType and argsCount of the command

methods.name: run
methods.description: Runs the command

methods.name: respond
methods.description: Responds to the command message

methods.name: editResponse
methods.description: Edits a response to the command message

methods.name: editCurrentResponse
methods.description: Edits the current response

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the channel the response is in ("DM" for direct messages)

methods.name: say
methods.description: Responds with a plain message

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Responds with a reply message

methods.name: direct
methods.description: Responds with a direct message

methods.name: code
methods.description: Responds with a code message

methods.name: embed
methods.description: Responds with an embed

methods.name: replyEmbed
methods.description: Responds with a mention + embed

methods.name: finalize
methods.description: Finalizes the command message by setting the responses and deleting any remaining prior ones

methods.name: deleteRemainingResponses
methods.description: Deletes any prior responses that haven't been updated

methods.name: parseArgs
methods.description: Parses an argument string into an array of arguments

params.name: argCount
params.description: The number of arguments to extract from the string

params.name: allowSingleQuote
params.description:
Whether or not single quotes should be allowed to wrap arguments,
in addition to double quotes

classes.name: SettingProvider
classes.description: Loads and stores settings associated with guilds

methods.name: init
methods.description:
Initialises the provider by connecting to databases and/or caching all data in memory.
{@link CommandoClient#setProvider} will automatically call this once the client is ready.

params.name: client
params.description: Client that will be using the provider

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys the provider, removing any event listeners.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Obtains a setting for a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild the setting is associated with (or 'global')

params.name: defVal
params.description: Value to default to if the setting isn't set on the guild

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets a setting for a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild to associate the setting with (or 'global')

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes a setting from a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild the setting is associated with (or 'global')

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Removes all settings in a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild to clear the settings of

methods.name: getGuildID
methods.description: Obtains the ID of the provided guild, or throws an error if it isn't valid

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild to get the ID of

classes.name: GuildSettingsHelper
classes.description: Helper class to use {@link SettingProvider} methods for a specific Guild

params.name: client
params.description: Client to use the provider of

props.name: client
props.description: Client to use the provider of

props.name: guild
props.description: Guild the settings are for

methods.name: get
methods.description: Gets a setting in the guild

params.name: defVal
params.description: Value to default to if the setting isn't set

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets a setting for the guild

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes a setting from the guild

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Removes all settings in the guild

classes.name: SyncSQLiteProvider
classes.description: Uses an SQLite database to store settings with guilds

props.name: conn
props.description: Database that will be used for storing/retrieving settings

props.name: client
props.description: Client that the provider is for (set once the client is ready, after using {@link CommandoClient#setProvider})

props.name: settings
props.description: Settings cached in memory, mapped by guild ID (or 'global')

props.name: listeners
props.description: Listeners on the Client, mapped by the event name

props.name: insertOrReplaceStmt
props.description: Prepared statement to insert or replace a settings row

props.name: deleteStmt
props.description: Prepared statement to delete an entire settings row

methods.name: setupGuild
methods.description: Loads all settings for a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild ID to load the settings of (or 'global')

methods.name: setupGuildCommand
methods.description: Sets up a command's status in a guild from the guild's settings

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild to set the status in

params.name: command
params.description: Command to set the status of

methods.name: setupGuildGroup
methods.description: Sets up a command group's status in a guild from the guild's settings

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild to set the status in

params.name: group
params.description: Group to set the status of

methods.name: updateOtherShards
methods.description: Updates a global setting on all other shards if using the {@link ShardingManager}.

params.name: key
params.description: Key of the setting to update

params.name: client
params.description: The client the argument type is for

params.name: id
params.description: The argument type ID (this is what you specify in {@link ArgumentInfo#type})

props.name: client
props.description: Client that this argument type is for

props.name: id
props.description: ID of this argument type (this is what you specify in {@link ArgumentInfo#type})

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Validates a value string against the type

params.name: arg
params.description: Argument the value was obtained from

returns.description: Whether the value is valid, or an error message

methods.name: parse
methods.description: Parses the raw value string into a usable value

params.name: arg
params.description: Argument the value was obtained from

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.description:
Checks whether a value is considered to be empty. This determines whether the default value for an argument
should be used and changes the response to the user under certain circumstances.

params.name: arg
params.description: Argument the value was obtained from

classes.name: ArgumentUnionType
classes.description: A type for command arguments that handles multiple other types

props.name: types
props.description: Types to handle, in order of priority

props.name: client
props.description: Client that this argument type is for

props.name: id
props.description: ID of this argument type (this is what you specify in {@link ArgumentInfo#type})

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Validates a value string against the type

params.name: arg
params.description: Argument the value was obtained from

returns.description: Whether the value is valid, or an error message

methods.name: parse
methods.description: Parses the raw value string into a usable value

params.name: arg
params.description: Argument the value was obtained from

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.description:
Checks whether a value is considered to be empty. This determines whether the default value for an argument
should be used and changes the response to the user under certain circumstances.

params.name: arg
params.description: Argument the value was obtained from

props.name: commandPrefix
props.description: Default command prefix

props.name: commandEditableDuration
props.description: Time in seconds that command messages should be editable

props.name: nonCommandEditable
props.description: Whether messages without commands can be edited to a command

props.name: owner
props.description: ID of the bot owner's Discord user, or multiple IDs

props.name: invite
props.description: Invite URL to the bot's support server

props.name: reason
props.description: Identifier for the reason the command is being blocked

props.name: response
props.description: Response being sent to the user

typedefs.name: Inhibitor
typedefs.description: A function that decides whether the usage of a command should be blocked

returns.description:
`false` if the command should *not* be blocked.
If the command *should* be blocked, then one of the following:
- A single string identifying the reason the command is blocked
- An Inhibition object

typedefs.name: CommandGroupResolvable
typedefs.description:
A CommandGroupResolvable can be:
* A CommandGroup
* A group ID

typedefs.name: CommandResolvable
typedefs.description:
A CommandResolvable can be:
* A Command
* A command name
* A CommandoMessage

props.name: key
props.description: Key for the argument

props.name: label
props.description: Label for the argument

props.name: prompt
props.description: First prompt for the argument when it wasn't specified

props.name: error
props.description: Predefined error message to output for the argument when it isn't valid

props.name: type
props.description:
Type of the argument (must be the ID of one of the registered argument types
or multiple IDs in order of priority separated by `|` for a union type - see
{@link CommandoRegistry#registerDefaultTypes} for the built-in types)

props.name: max
props.description:
If type is `integer` or `float`, this is the maximum value of the number.
If type is `string`, this is the maximum length of the string.

props.name: min
props.description:
If type is `integer` or `float`, this is the minimum value of the number.
If type is `string`, this is the minimum length of the string.

props.name: default
props.description: Default value for the argument (makes the arg optional - cannot be `null`)

props.name: oneOf
props.description: An array of values that are allowed to be used

props.name: infinite
props.description: Whether the argument accepts infinite values

props.name: validate
props.description: Validator function for the argument (see {@link ArgumentType#validate})

props.name: parse
props.description: Parser function for the argument (see {@link ArgumentType#parse})

props.name: isEmpty
props.description: Empty checker for the argument (see {@link ArgumentType#isEmpty})

props.name: wait
props.description: How long to wait for input (in seconds)

typedefs.name: ArgumentDefault
typedefs.description: Either a value or a function that returns a value. The function is passed the CommandoMessage and the Argument.

typedefs.name: ArgumentResult
typedefs.description: Result object from obtaining a single {@link Argument}'s value(s)

props.name: value
props.description: Final value(s) for the argument

props.name: cancelled
props.description:
One of:
- `user` (user cancelled)
- `time` (wait time exceeded)
- `promptLimit` (prompt limit exceeded)

props.name: prompts
props.description: All messages that were sent to prompt the user

props.name: answers
props.description: All of the user's messages that answered a prompt

props.name: usages
props.description: Maximum number of usages of the command allowed in the time frame.

props.name: duration
props.description: Amount of time to count the usages of the command within (in seconds).

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the command (must be lowercase)

props.name: aliases
props.description: Alternative names for the command (all must be lowercase)

props.name: autoAliases
props.description: Whether automatic aliases should be added

props.name: group
props.description: The ID of the group the command belongs to (must be lowercase)

props.name: memberName
props.description: The member name of the command in the group (must be lowercase)

props.name: description
props.description: A short description of the command

props.name: format
props.description:
The command usage format string - will be automatically generated if not specified,
and `args` is specified

props.name: details
props.description: A detailed description of the command and its functionality

props.name: examples
props.description: Usage examples of the command

props.name: guildOnly
props.description: Whether or not the command should only function in a guild channel

props.name: ownerOnly
props.description: Whether or not the command is usable only by an owner

props.name: clientPermissions
props.description: Permissions required by the client to use the command.

props.name: userPermissions
props.description: Permissions required by the user to use the command.

props.name: nsfw
props.description: Whether the command is usable only in NSFW channels.

props.name: throttling
props.description: Options for throttling usages of the command.

props.name: defaultHandling
props.description:
Whether or not the default command handling should be used.
If false, then only patterns will trigger the command.

props.name: args
props.description: Arguments for the command.

props.name: argsPromptLimit
props.description:
Maximum number of times to prompt a user for a single argument.
Only applicable if `args` is specified.

props.name: argsType
props.description:
One of 'single' or 'multiple'. Only applicable if `args` is not specified.
When 'single', the entire argument string will be passed to run as one argument.
When 'multiple', it will be passed as multiple arguments.

props.name: argsCount
props.description:
The number of arguments to parse from the command string.
Only applicable when argsType is 'multiple'. If nonzero, it should be at least 2.
When this is 0, the command argument string will be split into as many arguments as it can be.
When nonzero, it will be split into a maximum of this number of arguments.

props.name: argsSingleQuotes
props.description:
Whether or not single quotes should be allowed to box-in arguments
in the command string.

props.name: patterns
props.description: Patterns to use for triggering the command

props.name: guarded
props.description: Whether the command should be protected from disabling

props.name: hidden
props.description: Whether the command should be hidden from the help command

props.name: unknown
props.description:
Whether the command should be run when an unknown command is used - there
may only be one command registered with this property as `true`.

typedefs.name: ArgumentCollectorResult
typedefs.description: Result object from obtaining argument values from an {@link ArgumentCollector}

props.name: values
props.description: Final values for the arguments, mapped by their keys

props.name: cancelled
props.description:
One of:
- `user` (user cancelled)
- `time` (wait time exceeded)
- `promptLimit` (prompt limit exceeded)

props.name: prompts
props.description: All messages that were sent to prompt the user

props.name: answers
props.description: All of the user's messages that answered a prompt
